definition: elderly man/father/father-in-law/neck feathers of a bird (old)
Monopoly (game)/known as 地產大亨|地产大亨[Di4 chan3 Da4 heng1] in Taiwan

sentences.english: I found myself, at 81, an instant billionaire.
sentences.chinese: 我發現我自己以一位81歲的億萬富翁。

sentences.english: The day a Chinese multi-billionaire takes over Hollywood will be the time hell freezes over.
sentences.chinese: 中國億萬富翁接管好萊塢的那一天地獄都會凍結。

sentences.english: India's millionaire population grew 23% last year, the fastest in the world.
sentences.chinese: 去年印度的百萬富翁增加了23%，增幅居全球之冠。

sentences.english: Zillionaire Wallet, a wallet to amuses you and others.
sentences.chinese: 大富翁錢包，娛人娛己的趣味錢包。

sentences.english: " (Laughter) And then she said, "Dad, we're Lego rich.
sentences.chinese: 她還說，“爸爸，我們成樂高富翁了。”

sentences.english: The answer came like a bolt of thunder and the merchant was devastated.
sentences.chinese: 這回答象一聲炸雷，富翁徹底崩潰了。
他有個百萬富翁的父親。

sentences.english: The millionaire's property descended to his eldest son.
sentences.chinese: 那個百萬富翁的財產傳給了他的長子。

sentences.english: Billionaire mansions are often built like this.
sentences.chinese: 億萬富翁的公寓一般都建成這樣。

sentences.english: That wealthy man has his own jet.
sentences.chinese: 那位富翁擁有自己的噴射機。

sentences.english: A wealthy man fruitfully married a beautiful female movie star.
sentences.chinese: 一名富翁如願以償地娶到了一位美麗的女影星。

sentences.english: And now, Bogdashevsky is training the psyches of a couple of wealthy foreigners.
sentences.chinese: 現在博格達什維斯基在爲幾個國外富翁做心理訓練。

sentences.english: Cheung Kong (Holdings) Ltd., controlled by billionaire Li Ka-shing, also took part.
sentences.chinese: 億萬富翁李嘉誠控制的長江基建也參與了其中。

sentences.english: Multi-millionaire Coleen is due to give birth any day.
sentences.chinese: 百萬富翁科林哪天肯定會生小孩。

sentences.english: May I ask where you can read for free men have won the football?
sentences.chinese: 請問哪裏可以免費看足彩富翁報？

sentences.english: And therein lies the problem for this self-made billionaire.
sentences.chinese: 這個白手起家的億萬富翁也面臨着問題。

definition: poor wretch/pauper/destitute man/poverty-stricken peasant/penniless good-for-nothing/impecunious vagabond
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy
Monopoly (game)/known as 地產大亨|地产大亨[Di4 chan3 Da4 heng1] in Taiwan
